programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave goes head to head with an old rival, who is famous for making one of the most successful purchases in the history of the storage scene.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A look back at some of the Pawn Stars' best vehicular buys, including a classic 1949 Hudson Commodore.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The most famous finds in the shop's history, including a 40-year-old Bob Dylan album and a suit worn by James Brown.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth ignores Ashley's wish to ban a troublesome customer - but his decision threatens to put the shop at risk. Meanwhile, Les commissions a striking masterpiece.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth hatches a plan to get more customers through the pawn shop doors. His new idea backfires, and Les is forced to reconsider his choice of manager.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: An antique horse-drawn sleigh arrives at the shop needing a complete transformation for the holidays. Big Mike comes by with a 1930s Dixie Cup dispenser that is missing a key part.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick turns to Danny Koker from Counting Cars for help with a mysterious scooter, and a dentist brings the guys a 1920s x-ray machine that may be too dangerous to restore.

programme.title: Motives & Murders
programme.desc: Investigators reveal how they unravelled a business manager's endless string of lies to discover who had the means and motive to shoot him dead.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: When a former actor is gunned down in Yuma, Arizona, a police chase leads across the southwest until they finally get their man.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Bubba faces a tough decision, and Matt Blevins enters into a battle of the sexes with female bidders in the small town of Pantego.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Kenny Stowe shows off his wealth during an auction in Dallas, and Bubba responds by challenging him to a bidding war.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Ed Byrne, Gary Delaney, Katherine Ryan and Josh Widdicombe for an edition of the comedy quiz from September 2014. The panellists give their take on major news stories and participate in a series of stand-up spots and improvised games.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedian James Acaster, TV presenters Gabby Logan and Melvin Odoom and Cold Feet star Fay Ripley join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show in which participants attempt to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the quiz with a difference as comedians Hannah Gadsby, Noel Fielding and Joe Lycett join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the theme of pictures, with points being awarded not only for correct answers, but also for interesting ones.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Former BBC Breakfast presenter Bill Turnbull, Death in Paradise star Ben Miller and comedienne Jo Brand compete to have their pet hates banished on the light-hearted panel show chaired by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include middle-lane drivers, personalised number plates, low-slung jeans and homeopathy.

programme.title: Asian Provocateur
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan and his mother head to Colorado, where they join his cousin Krishna at a ranch. Shanthi is anxious for her son to use his life experience to teach Krishna how to 'be a man', but when Romesh proves incapable of tackling the duties of a farm-hand, his standing with his seasoned cowboy cousin quickly dwindles. Determined to make up for his mistakes, the comedian takes Krishna away from the ranch to meet a real-life superhero, and finally manages to gain ground by teaching him a thing or two about dealing with girls. However, his success might come at a price should Krishna decide to tell his mother Saroja what he has learned.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Looking to make friends, Brian heads to a trendy new bar, but he finds himself a big hit with the clientele, so something must be awry.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A succession of knifings leaves the police facing a potential double murder investigation. The team raid the house of a suspected drug dealer and discover weapons.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Picking in New Mexico for the first time ever, the guys head straight to Roswell, but take a detour to a Wild West town with a million-dollar item for sale.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages in Leeds.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: In the penultimate episode, an unlikely pairing enrages bidders in Birmingham, Linda is determined to keep her game face on despite Dan's jibes, and Nat and John are at each other's throats. Sean Kelly hosts.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A daredevil stuntman lives up to his legend in New Mexico and Mike looks for some divine intervention on a must-have pick.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Featuring a Texas attorney, who has a second life as a super picker, and possesses a wild warehouse of eclectic things.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Mick Sweetmore's team tries to fix a radio issue in a bid to keep the new pursuit cars on the tail of Merseyside's criminals. There's a surprise visit from the fleet's oldest member, and the bosses get dirty hands when things go wrong on the road.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio travel to Italy to test high-performance hatchbacks. Jeremy Clarkson is in the Citroen DS3 Racing, Richard Hammond champions the Fiat 500C Abarth and James May makes the case for the Renaultsport Clio 200 Cup as they navigate their way round baffling Italian towns and take part in a scavenger hunt, before putting the cars through their paces on the F1 street circuit in Monaco. Also, petrolhead comedian Ross Noble is in the Reasonably Priced Car and the McLaren MP4-12C supercar comes under review.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A group of angry locals trap an innocent man in a telephone box and accuse him of being a paedophile, and a woman claims her boyfriend is trying to kill her.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: The team transform a 1958 Chevy Apache into a Vintage Dirt Bike Hauler. Elsewhere, Steve Darnell attempts to bring Evel Knievel's Formula 1 Dragster back to life.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond find second-hand bargains for the same price as the Â£6,995 Nissan Pixo. James May is in Nevada to test the toughness of the Range Rover Evoque, driving it through Death Valley before chauffeuring a megastar across Las Vegas. Plus, the McLaren MP4-12C is compared with its supercar rival the Ferrari 458 Italia, and four-time Formula One world champion Sebastian Vettel is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio try to make train travel cheaper, faster and more interesting, replacing the locomotive with a specially modified car and the carriages with a series of caravans. Comedy star Rowan Atkinson gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car and Jeremy Clarkson drives the Jaguar XKR-S and a Nissan GT-R round the track to compare both models.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the quiz with a difference as comedians Hannah Gadsby, Noel Fielding and Joe Lycett join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the theme of pictures, with points being awarded not only for correct answers, but also for interesting ones.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedian Hugh Dennis, presenter Gaby Roslin, actress Beattie Edmondson and journalist Amol Rajan take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Countdown dictionary expert Susie Dent, comedian Bob Mortimer and TV presenters Ore Oduba and Stacey Solomon join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show in which participants attempt to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? At Christmas
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts a festive edition of the comedy panel show in which the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the Christmas fun are former Test Match Special commentator Henry Blofeld, Witless star Kerry Howard, broadcaster the Rev Richard Coles and BBC News presenter Clive Myrie. They all reveal amazing stories, but are they telling the truth, or making it all up?.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the quiz with a difference as Pointless co-presenter Richard Osman and comedians Romesh Ranganathan and Rachel Parris join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the theme of picnics, with points being awarded not only for correct answers, but also for interesting ones.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, with Strictly Come Dancing judge Craig Revel Horwood, actress Sheila Hancock and 8 Out of 10 Cats regular Jon Richardson arguing to have the things they hate consigned to the notorious room, while host Frank Skinner has the final say. Their gripes include house guests, women's toilets and dancing - and one of the celebrities even wants rid of their own brain.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Former BBC Breakfast presenter Bill Turnbull, Death in Paradise star Ben Miller and comedienne Jo Brand compete to have their pet hates banished on the light-hearted panel show chaired by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include middle-lane drivers, personalised number plates, low-slung jeans and homeopathy.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Countdown dictionary expert Susie Dent, comedian Bob Mortimer and TV presenters Ore Oduba and Stacey Solomon join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show in which participants attempt to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Jardine receives help from an unexpected source during his investigations into a girl's mysterious death - a spiritualist who not only seems to have been the killer's intended victim, but also claims to be in touch with the ghost of Jim Taggart. James Macpherson and Blythe Duff star.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch are called to a hotel fire and discover blocked escape routes threaten the safety of guests. Elsewhere, Sicknote has finally had enough of politics.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Lady Jane makes a spectacular reappearance in Lovejoy's life just as he decides it is time to settle down - leaving him forced to choose between her and Charlotte. Meanwhile, faithful companion Tinker prepares to retire just as Eric Catchpole makes an unscheduled return to the fold. Last ever episode of the comedy drama, starring Ian McShane, Dudley Sutton, Caroline Langrishe, Phyllis Logan and Chris Jury.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the inspirational Bluebell Cottage in Cheshire, which is open to the public as part of the National Gardens Scheme project.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The fusiliers are brought in to collect rubbish due to a national strike, and CSM Chick Henwood finds his loyalties tested as his brother is one of the strikers.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy and Dave plan a betting scam when the top boxer Corporal Tony Wilton is knocked out of the team, but their scheme falls apart when Wilton is recalled.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jaws drop at Sun Hill as June Ackland returns to take up the post of sergeant, a mere two months after her retirement. It's no secret she needs the money to clear Jim's gambling debts - but she makes it plain she's not prepared to be a figure of fun or pity. Meanwhile, Gary finds himself implicated in a money-laundering operation after falling for a woman's charms, and Andrea agonises over whether to tell Neil the reason for her refusal to commit to a relationship.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Ric's ex-wife arrives at the hospital as the new registrar, quickly making her mark on the wards - putting Connie in her place as she does so. Carlos treats a patient suffering extensive burns, and Zubin awaits the board meeting that will decide his fate - but even though he is determined to resign, Jess persuades him to fight his corner. However, both are surprised when help emerges from an unexpected quarter.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A man is admitted after falling from his motorbike, and his friend vents his frustration by lashing out on the staff. Charlie suggests to Baz he regrets the events of the previous evening and makes plans to move out. Edmund attacks Tina.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: June leaps to Roger's defence after the leader of a gang of rowdy schoolgirls accuses him of indecent assault, and later plants a kiss on the startled copper - leaving an ominous question mark hanging over her already troubled relationship with Jim. Gary swears revenge on the female con-artist who inveigled him into the money laundering scam, and Leela is dismayed to learn Amber will be joining her on an advanced driving course, while Andrea tries to avoid exposure as an undercover journalist by promising her editor a scoop on Gabriel's murderous misdeeds.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Arthur is hurt when he asks Mark for help, Grant's criminal friends turn up at the Vic with bad news, and Ian sees a face from the past.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil finds out about Grant's financial problems, and Sam is cheesed off about having to model in Dutch costume.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Drama about the lives of firefighters at Blackwall Fire Station. Malcolm tries to comfort Helen when she is sacked by a jealous Peter..

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: A young restaurateur battles to save his family's sprawling family estate in the Highlands after he is called back from London by his eccentric mother. First episode of the light-hearted Scottish drama, starring Richard Briers, Alastair Mackenzie and Susan Hampshire.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim investigates the theft of diamonds from leading Jersey socialite Lady Trowbridge. Detective drama, starring John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Cousin Shifty is up to his old criminal tricks which leads to a bust up with Joey. Aveline brings home her 'unsuitable' fiance, Oswald.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Ballroom dancers Barry and Yvonne throw a party in their chalet, inviting only those members of staff they consider socially acceptable - which counts out comic Ted Bovis for a start. Jimmy Perry and David Croft's holiday camp comedy, starring Simon Cadell, Ruth Madoc and Jeffrey Holland.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Sandy worries she has a stalker when she spots someone following her home at night. Lionel's efforts to calm the situation are unsuccessful, so Alistair steps in to help and manages to uncover the mysterious man's identity.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Howard Remembers Where He Left His Bicycle Pump
programme.desc: Howard is embarrassed when he bumps into an acquaintance from his past, and Truly's bid to help him backfires. Long-running comedy, starring Robert Fyfe, Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.sub-title: In Pursuit of the Proper Sinner
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Newly demoted Havers joins Lynley on a double murder investigation. After a girl is killed and her camping companion stabbed, two separate lines of inquiry lead the duo into a murky world of deception, corruption and prostitution in their bid to discover the murderer's identity. Mystery drama, starring Nathaniel Parker, Sharon Small, Timothy West and Simon Williams.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team tracks vicious criminal Chopper Hadley, who is back in the country for a week, with Brian going undercover to apprehend the villain. Patrick Malahide (The Inspector Alleyn Mysteries) guest stars, with Dennis Waterman, James Bolam and Alun Armstrong.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Jardine and the team investigate a drugs-related death on a local housing estate, but initially run up against a wall of silence - until the discovery of two more bodies forces them to turn their inquiries in a completely new direction. Gritty drama, starring James Macpherson and Blythe Duff.

programme.title: Tyson Fury: The Gypsy King
programme.desc: The opening instalment in a three-part documentary following the boxer as he prepares for his rematch with Deontay Wilder for the WBC World Heavyweight title, after the first contest in December 2018 ended in a much-disputed draw. Filmed over several months, the programme provides an insight into the life of one of British sport's most flamboyant and controversial characters and those who are closest to him.

programme.title: The Home Game
programme.desc: A young Twickenham couple blow their budget out of the water with a Â£30,000 bathroom makeover, while a mother and daughter have their granny annexe transformed and a DIY bespoke walnut kitchen in Somerset is created.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of current affairs and entertainment, including an interview with Hollywood A-lister Al Pacino and co-star Logan Lerman about their new Amazon TV drama Hunters.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Stephen is in court to claim compensation from a friend for damaging his DJ equipment during a gig. Defendant Robbie admits he is responsible but cannot afford to pay and needs more time.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five bed specialists answer questions on subjects including Blue Peter, capital cities and Robert De Niro films, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Quiz, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Shamus, Lynn, Hollie and Ian pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Party Political Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Scottish Green Party.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon loses faith, Cain and Moira brace themselves, and Liam and Leyla are thwarted.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Cain is in shock, Paddy stays strong, and Leyla makes a move.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: In 10 years Airbnb has grown into a multimillion-dollar global entity - and revolutionised the way people travel. But there are claims that short-term lets not only threaten the future of traditional hotels, but could be contributing to housing shortages - as well as driving up the cost of properties. Jonathan Maitland investigates.

programme.title: Tyson Fury: The Gypsy King
programme.desc: The heavyweight celebrates a victory over Thomas Schwartz in Las Vegas by enjoying a night of heavy drinking back home in Morecambe and video-calling rival Anthony Joshua. This angers his wife Paris, who is reminded of his alcohol abuse during his years of depression, and Fury looks to make amends by treating the family to a day out in Blackpool and booking a family holiday. The boxer then heads to Marbella with trainer Ben Davison, before preparing to face his next opponent Otto Wallin back in Vegas, in what proves to be a challenging fight.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Save Money: Lose Weight
programme.desc: Over the past 25 years, portion sizes have increased by 100 per cent - and plates have got bigger too - none of which is good news for people's diet. With this in mind, Ranj Singh checks out the breakfast buffet to see whether people know how many calories they are piling on their plates and Sian Williams tests off-the-shelf portion-control gadgets, including smaller cutlery to help eat more slowly. Plus, two more diets are put to the test - the Metabolism Reset Diet, based around a detox for the liver, and Bosh! Healthy Vegan, which means ditching the junk.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: When a woman is found dead laid out in the shape of a crucifix on Jesus Green, Will and Geordie are led to a nearby convent where they meet steely Sister Grace, who rules over her flock with an iron fist. Even more sinister is the picture that starts to emerge as they match the nuns to a series of unsolved missing persons cases from the previous five years. Meanwhile, when Leonard's father, Russell, arrives in Grantchester, it's clear there's no love lost between parent and son. Robson Green, Tom Brittney, Tracy-Ann Oberman and Sean Gilder star.

programme.title: 90s vs 00s: Cover Hits
programme.desc: We all love a cover - but which decade did them better, the nineties or noughties?.

programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.desc: They're one of the biggest bands around, The 1975 are seriously hot right now! Here are some of thier biggest hits.

programme.title: Hotmix
programme.desc: Exclusive non-stop mix of the hottest tracks to soundtrack your life!.

programme.title: Rewind! Top 20 Hits Of 2013
programme.desc: We're throwing it backand counting down the top 20 songs from 2013.

programme.title: Birthday Showdown: Rihanna vs Mabel
programme.desc: It's two queens birthday! To celebrate we're battling out the two brithday girls, Rihanna & Mabel's videos to see who comes out on top.

programme.title: Hit After Hit
programme.desc: Nothing but the biggest hits by your favourite stars back to back.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How to blow the world's finest crystal, make the slimmest TVs, heat the deepest swimming pool, and fill a million bottles a day of the world's favourite ketchup.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: A pickup truck is a stateside icon and Mike Brewer is keen to get into the booming classic truck market. He manages to find a 1950s Ford F-1, which is an unfinished project. mechanic Edd China creates a paint scheme based on a 'sandstorm in the desert'.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: A house relocation goes wrong as drivers Ross and Jerry are faced with power poles blocking their way. Plus, Russell tackles a graveyard of wrecked cars in the heart of the desert.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: In a break with tradition, the team designs a bike suitable for mass production. After a slow start, Vinnie DiMartino gets a boost when he receives some news.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Butch foolishly trusted his 1969 Camaro to a restoration rip-off artist, so the Fantomworks team sets out to fix the mind-boggling mistakes and give Butch the car of his dreams.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe carries out a repair 8,500 feet above the city of Palm Springs when he goes to work on a troubled building site.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The production methods used for beet sugar, film used in instant cameras, and electric roadsters.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Underwater Robots/Ski and Trekking Poles/Band Saws/Lasagne
programme.desc: How underwater robots, ski and trekking poles, band saws and lasagne are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Investigating how one of the slipperiest substances known to man is used to make waterproof clothing for explorers, mountaineers and special forces soldiers.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Junk experts Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit Dan, a born-and-raised New Englander whose collection might turn out to be off-limits.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Following a breakdown, Edgar is forced to undertake a dangerous repair, while Sig loses his temper in the face of questionable counting. On board the Cornelia Marie, Phil's health deteriorates drastically, which begins to affect the crew.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Shawn returns from prison determined to make up for lost time, while Zeke and Emily's relationship buckles under the strain of work.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: A house relocation goes wrong as drivers Ross and Jerry are faced with power poles blocking their way. Plus, Russell tackles a graveyard of wrecked cars in the heart of the desert.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: Trading Up
programme.desc: Mike Brewer is on a worldwide mission - to turn a cheap runabout into a supercar in as fewer trades as possible. In this edition, he searches for a Chevy Opala in Brazil.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini tracks down a Porsche for restoration, but after seeing the elements of an impressive car collection, he may have trouble letting it go.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini restores a 1960 Morgan Roadster to its former glory.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Junk experts Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit Dan, a born-and-raised New Englander whose collection might turn out to be off-limits.

programme.title: Railroad Alaska
programme.desc: Danny and Animal bring out a snowplough to clear the way for a freight train hauling vital diesel, while Mary and Clyde need a generator.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: As the crews feel the pressure of life at sea, Sig and Edgar on the Northwestern see who can stay awake the longest, while the captain of the Time Bandit has a brush with death.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.sub-title: And No More Shall We Part
programme.desc: Zeke, Emily and Steve mourn the death of a friend, while Steve and Cody battle to patch a hole in the hull of the Christine Rose.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a Kent antiques emporium specialising in unusual European antiques, and indulges in 1940s nostalgia at a home-front museum in south-west Wales.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: While preparing for a gruelling trip from Perth to Darwin, Steve contends a malfunctioning clutch. Robbie and his crew embark on a challenging trip moving a timber house.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: A pickup truck is a stateside icon and Mike Brewer is keen to get into the booming classic truck market. He manages to find a 1950s Ford F-1, which is an unfinished project. mechanic Edd China creates a paint scheme based on a 'sandstorm in the desert'.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Junk experts Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz are picking and dreaming in California when Mike falls for the sweetest classic Ford pick-up he has ever seen.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard is captivated by Hesleyside Hall, a Northumbrian country house full of potential salvaging gold, hoping its owners will put a bargain or two his way.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer gets his hands on a valuable 1995 Ford Escort RS Cosworth, hoping new mechanic Ant Anstead can restore the 227hp engine's famous 'fizz'.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard and Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland head to Somerset to hunt down a 1970s VW Type 3 Fastback. They also revamp a Rover P6 built at the height of the British Leyland crisis.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How a set of jaws are forged, capable of chomping through concrete and demolish tower blocks. Plus, the ways an historic airman's bomber jacket can be stiched, and the means of brewing the oldest beer in the Western world.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in cooling the iconic Sydney Opera House. Plus, an insight into how Sheffield steel is transformed into a carpenter's handsaw, and the production of a microphone capable of picking up a whisper.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: A bank manager is held hostage by a gang and forced to take part in a robbery to save her daughter. However, when the criminals are caught, they claim she was really an accomplice.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A devastating house fire results in the deaths of a man and his stepchildren, and investigators try to determine whether the tragic incident was the result of arson.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: The murder of Tara Lynn Grant, reported missing in February 2007 by her husband Stephen, but whose dismembered body parts were later found in their home. Police managed to track Grant, by now a fugitive, to a state park in Northern Michigan and arrested him before he froze to death.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.sub-title: Roses Are Red, Murder Is Too
programme.desc: The death of a town council member. Local residents were appalled - especially when the evidence began to suggest a professional 'hit' had taken place.

programme.title: James Patterson's Murder Is Forever
programme.desc: The best-selling author revisits the 2015 case of Dee Dee Blancharde, who was stabbed to death in their house. Less than 48 hours later, daughter Gypsy and her online boyfriend Nicholas Godejohn were arrested for her mother's murder.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: A police officer spots a pony wandering along the motorway, and the team tries to locate its owner.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Series featuring vets from locations all over Australia, including Dr Peter Ricci, Dr Alex Hynes, Dr Kate Adams, Dr Lewis Hunt and Dr Danni Dusek. In this episode, Dr Kate discovers dachshund Gary has a life-threatening condition. Dr Alex is under pressure to deliver 12 puppies, and Dr Peter performs surgery on a lion.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: New consultant Carmel receives a tall order from her first customer of the day, while another woman wants to spend $2,000 on an elaborate red dress.
